title: EP 28: Charles Covey - MyGrip
itunes:title: EP 28: Charles Covey - MyGrip
description:
In this episode of The Tactical Entrepreneur podcast, Steve is with Charles Covey. They talk about how he came up with MyGrip, overcoming hurdles, his future plans for MyGrip, Stored information and multiple use cases. 

 

Time Stamps:

[1:08] Who is Charles Covey and what brought him to where he is today?
[3:16] How he came up with my grip.
[7:54] His first custom gun.
[16:18] Inventing my grip and his future plans.
[25:16] Stored information and multiple use cases.

 

“My approach to anything that I ever do is that there's always a better way... how could I do this better?”

   - Charles Covey

 

About The Guest:

Charles Covey often tells people that he didn’t choose entrepreneurship - it chose him. Having his own businesses since the age of 8, mowing lawns, Charles has made plenty of mistakes and had a few successes along the way. Creating new ventures and solving tough problems are two of the most exciting things in life, the way Charles sees it. The lifestyle he’s created means its hard to tell if he’s working or playing since it’s all intertwined in a beautiful manner. From real estate development to investment fund management to custom gun grips, it’s all in a fun day’s work. With 5 companies that have done over 7 figures, Charles is staring at the 9 figure mark as his next goal. Along with his entrepreneur wife Elisha, there’s no telling what the Covey’s will create next.

https://www.linkedin.com/in/charles-covey/
https://www.facebook.com/Charles-Covey-345817616184209/

 

How To Get Involved:

Steve Schabacker is the co-founder of Sheepdog Firearms and an entrepreneur, bestselling author, and marketer. Between his business and his content, Steve is educating firearm owners and armed professionals and setting a new standard for shops and training centers in the industry.

You can visit Sheepdog Firearms online or reach out directly to Steve at sschabacker@outlook.com.

Check out this podcast on Apple Podcasts - don’t forget to subscribe, rate, and review!
